#Text=Prune Fuschias
#Text=Fuchsias come in many varieties , from hedges to flowering baskets , and produce beautiful purple flowers .
#Text=Though fuchsias are typically treated as annuals , they can be cut back and grown again the following year .
#Text=You should plan on pruning twice a year , once during the spring and once during the summer to have a healthy , flowering fuchsia plant !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Pruning
#Text=at the Start of Spring
#Text=Use hand shears or snips for pruning .
#Text=Make sure your tools are sharpened before you use them .
#Text=Sanitize your tools with rubbing alcohol before and after you cut each plant .
#Text=This helps prevent the spread of bacteria and disease .
#Text=Purchase shears and snips at your local gardening store or online .
#Text=Wear gardening gloves if you want to have an improved grip on the shears .
#Text=In most cases , a sharp pair of household scissors should work for pruning fuchsias .
#Text=Just make sure to sanitize them first .
#Text=Wait until the last frost has passed to start pruning .
#Text=The dead branches help protect the root systems from the frost .
#Text=After the last frost date , which should happen in later April or early May depending on your area , you can take off the branches .
#Text=You may see new spring growth happening underneath the old branches before you remove them .
#Text=If you live in the United States , you can use your ZIP code to check the expected last frost date here : https://garden.org/apps/frost-dates/ from the surface of the ground . ” | } }
#Text=Make a 45-degree cut to remove any dead or broken shoots .
#Text=Snip the branch at the base of the plant or where the wood is healthy .
#Text=Leave darker colored wood and cut away pale or faded wood .
#Text=If a branch is broken , make your cut just below the break .
#Text=Cuts made at an angle will help water run off the stem and prevent any fungal diseases .
#Text=The leaves on fuchsia branches will be brown and withering while any new growths that have developed will have green leaves .
#Text=It will look like you 're removing almost the entirety of the plant , but it will regrow .
#Text=Cut one-third of the length off of healthy branches .
#Text=Make your cut at a 45-degree angle to prevent disease .
#Text=Cutting back will help promote more healthy growths and will help keep your fuchsias a uniform size .
#Text=Only do this for growths from the previous season .
#Text=The current season 's growth will be small if it 's present at all .
#Text=Shaping Your Fuchsias in the Summer
#Text=Remove any branches that interfere with other plants .
#Text=Cut your fuchsias back so they are contained in their area .
#Text=Any plants that crowd together will compete for sunlight and resources , making them grow less efficiently .
#Text=Prune the growing tip on stems to promote branching .
#Text=The end of each new branch will continue to grow outwards if left on your fuchsia .
#Text=Make your cut above the knobby spots on the stem where leaves grow on the stem , otherwise known as a node .
#Text=Flowering will be delayed until later in the season , but your fuchsia will produce more flowers for a longer amount of time .
#Text=Long branches will get heavy with leaves and flowers and could break under strong winds .
#Text=Cut above nodes that have 2 leaves .
#Text=Leaf nodes will split into 2 or 3 individual branches that produce more flowers when they 're cut back .
#Text=Count up from the main stem to the second or third node with 2 leaves and make your cut .
#Text=The leaves on each node will grow on the opposite side of one another .
#Text=This makes new branches spread out .
#Text=Trim fuchsia hedges to a uniform height and width .
#Text=Remove any spindly branches growing inside the shrub .
#Text=This helps the air flow through the plant and prevents fungal disease .
#Text=Keep hedges clean and shaped .
#Text=Use a larger pair of hedge shears to cut a large area in a short amount of time .
#Text=Tips
#Text=It may seem daunting to cut back your fuchsias so close to the ground , but the root system will help it grow back quickly !
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Hand shears
#Text=Garden snips
#Text=Pruning gloves
